itemDescription: English flower and fruit painter and illustrator

wikipedia_page.main: Mary Harrison (1788 – 25 November 1875) was an English flower and fruit painter, and illustrator. She became popularly called the "Rose and Primrose painter". She has also been known as Mary P. Harrison and Mary Rossiter Harrison.

response: * November 25 – Mary Harrison, English flower and fruit painter and illustrator (born 1788)
*Mary Harrison (artist) (1788–1875), English flower and fruit painter, and illustrator
*Mary Harrison McKee (1858–1930), first lady to her father President Benjamin Harrison, when her mother, Caroline Harrison, was seriously ill and then died
** Mary Harrison, English flower and fruit painter, and illustrator (died 1875)

Born in Liverpool, he was the second son of Mary Harrison, the flower-painter. He went to London aged 14, and worked for dealers. Subsequently he made anatomical and other medical drawings and illustrations, and studied anatomy at the Hunterian school in Windmill Street. He had much support from John Constable, who advised him to observe nature closely.

*Mary Beale, Susan Penelope Rosse, Anne Killigrew, Maria Verelst, Anne, Princess of Orange, Princess Caroline, Agatha van der Mijn, Sarah Hoadly, Elizabeth Blackwell, Mary Delany, Frances Reynolds, Angelica Kauffman, Mary Moser, Maria Cosway, Mary Harrison, Anna Maria Charretie, Adelaide Agnes Maguire
